data.title: Remove Toolbox and all game binaries
data.body: Remove the old Toolbox (and Qt libs) and all game binaries from the _development_ branch.

data.title: Updated logic in MissionArea::getServerObject
data.body:
As noted in [this thread](http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/125744), `MissionArea::getServerObject` has some awful performance implications. This function iterates through every server-side object to find a MissionArea.

This commit adds a new static member to MissionArea, `smServerObject`, which is used in place of the old brute-force search. This member is updated in `onAdd` and `onRemove`, and returned by `getServerObject`, which is now a guaranteed constant-time function call.

NOTE: The commit message is slightly wrong. The old function didn't iterate over every server-side object; it iterated over all scope-always objects, a subset of the world. Still, not good news.

VS2010 and .rc files
Fix for Issue #132 for RenderOcclusionMgr Rendering
data.body: RenderOcclusionMgr now uses a simple shader.

data.title: RenderOcclusionMgr uses fixed function rendering
data.body:
Originally from THREED-1890

The RenderOcclusionMgr uses the fixed function render path to render occlusion shapes. Fixed function is implemented thru a very large shader on most hardware which has a higher than normal state change cost.

We should fix RenderOcclusionMgr to create a Material and MaterialInstance and use it for rendering occlusion shapes with a very simple zwrite only shader.

data.title: Fix for Issue #130 for Decals and Smoothing Groups
data.body: Decals use the correct visual geometry normals when clipped against TSStatic meshes.

data.title: Decals not obeying smoothing groups on meshes
data.body:
Originally from THREED-1684

Where the decal is applied to a static mesh, the smoothing groups of the mesh are not obeyed, and the decal appears faceted. (Decals are frequently used to obscure seams between meshes and terrain)

data.title: Fix for Issue #128 for Player First Person Shadow
data.body: IMPROVEMENT: By default we stop rendering all Player shadows when in first person and 'renderFirstPerson' is disabled.  Added flag 'firstPersonShadows' to disable this behavior.

data.title: Soldier shadow displayed in 1st-person view looks wrong with no feet
data.body:
Originally from THREED-2739

The soldier shadow displayed in 1st person view shows the soldiers feet, but looks wrong because there are no legs/feet models that the shadows are originating from. 

To reproduce:
1. Launch any level with the soldier model and shadows.
2. Look down in 1st-person camera view with the sun to your back.
   Bug: the play shadow makes it look like he is floating because his shadow doesn't originate from his feet.

data.title: Fix for Issue #126 for TCPObject Bad Connect
TCPObject gives "Got bad connected receive event"
data.body:
Originally from THREED-2327

Source: http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/127137

OS: Win7 32-bit

As the title says, TCPObject is not very good when it comes to doing anything aside from listening. There have been several threads about the problem (and workarounds):

Bug thread for 1.1 Preview States: "Bug does not occur on Mac OS X 10.6.8 Torque 3D 1.0.1 with same code"
 www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/57840
 www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/74396
 www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/36871

To reproduce, create a TCPObject and set it to listen on a port, then telnet or connect to it using another Torque instance (or any TCP app to connect to it) and when you send data, you will get "Got bad connected receive event".

data.title: Fix for Issue #122 for Material Sounds
Issue in Material Editor Setting for Sounds
data.body:
Originally from THREED-2083

Source: http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/126676

Issue: the material editor was pushing the footstep sound into the impact sound selection box. fix below.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch into the world editor
2. Go into the material editor
3. Set different sounds for a material's Footstep and Impact settings. 
   BUG-What you will find is that the selected sounds are properly written to the materialblock but once the material is saved and reloaded into the mat editor, the footstep sound is the grab for the Impact sound Gui element.

Fix:
 materialEditor.ed.cs , around line 794

MaterialEditorGui.updateSoundPopup("Footstep", (%material).footstepSoundId, (%material).customFootstepSound);
 MaterialEditorGui.updateSoundPopup("Impact", (%material).footstepSoundId, (%material).customFootstepSound);

to

MaterialEditorGui.updateSoundPopup("Footstep", (%material).footstepSoundId, (%material).customFootstepSound);
 MaterialEditorGui.updateSoundPopup("Impact", (%material).impactSoundId, (%material).customImpactSound);

data.title: Fix for Issue #120 for Inverted ArrayObject Sort
ArrayObject Sort - Desc Parameter is inverted
data.body:
Originally from THREED-3178

Source: http://www.garagegames.com/community/forums/viewthread/129494

Hi,

In ArrayObject, it is said:
 @param descending optional True for descending sort, false for ascending sort\n

If you call ArrayObj.Sort(True) which should be descending (highest value to lowest) you get the opposite.

How to reproduce:
 Construct array object with 3 item which value are 1,2,3 and try the sort function

Fix: Change the documentation to the correct description
